impl.owl
Class CastingList<E extends OWLIndividual>

java.lang.Object
  impl.owl.OWLIndividualListImpl<E>
      impl.owl.CastingList<E>
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Iterable<E>, java.util.Collection<E>, java.util.List<E>, OWLIndividualList<E>
public class CastingList<E extends OWLIndividual>
extends OWLIndividualListImpl<E>

Implementation of a list with dynamic cast behavior. Instances will be created by specifying i.) the target OWL individual type to which all elements of this list will tried to cast on read access via getter or iterator. In other words, casting lists are not compile-time type safe and may throw casting exceptions at runtime. Optionally, instances can also be created by injecting an existing list that may contain subclasses of OWLIndividual. If the elements of this list can be casted to the target OWL individual type everything is fine. Otherwise, clients will experience above-mentioned exceptions.

getIndividual

public E getIndividual(java.lang.String localName)
Description copied from interface: OWLIndividualList
Get the individual from the list that has the given local name. If there are more than one individual with the same local name than any one of them is returned.

Specified by:
getIndividual in interface OWLIndividualList<E extends OWLIndividual>
Overrides:
getIndividual in class OWLIndividualListImpl<E extends OWLIndividual>
Parameters:
localName - The local name of the target individual.
Returns:
The individual having the given local name, or null if no such individual exists.
